Job Summary: The Analytics team empowers BDSA through the development of syndicated market research products based on various datasets. As a Junior Data Scientist, you will work on highly complex projects supporting the Product and Professional Services teams with data wrangling, data cleaning, and data reporting tools and techniques.
Your day-to-day activities will involve using heterogeneous datasets to derive insights and automation. For example, combining public weather data with proprietary sales data to identify trends and build forecasts, or using ML/AI tools to parse large datasets and deduplicate data.
QC/QA processes are critical elements of this work and you will spend substantial time automating and managing automated QC/QA systems. The datasets grow substantially day by day and automation of the QC/QA environment is a top priority.
This is a fast-paced environment with a variety of challenges, many of which are driven by external factors. If you're excited to work on new projects, constantly find ways to overcome obstacles, and find joy in solving problems than this may be the job for you. As a junior data scientist, you'll work under the direction of senior team members and be expected to rapidly learn new tools and techniques. While work will be guided by more seasoned team members, your intellect, technical skills, and creativity will be highly valued and there is room for advancement.
Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
Maintain models and projections for cannabis retail sales
Developing QC/QA techniques for disparate data sources
Integrating retail sales data across disparate markets to enable comparisons
Implementing QC/QA techniques in production systems
Work hand-in-hand with technology team members to utilize available technologies
Respond to client data quality questions
Support the Product team through ad hoc analyses, capabilities overviews, and prototyping
Work with a variety of data science tools and programming languages such as Python, R, etc.
NOTE: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Required Experience and/or Other Qualifications:
Degree in data science, statistics, economics, or a similar field (experience may be substituted for educational requirements)
Expertise with Python and R Studio
Expertise with data visualization software such Power BI
Desired Experience and/or Other Qualifications:
Experience analyzing and solving CPG-focused challenges including but not limited to: forecasting, projections, assortment, innovation planning, pricing elasticity, etc.
Experience in the cannabis industry
Web scraping
Unstructured text analysis
ML/AI prototyping
Salary Range: $90,000 - $110,000 + annual bonus + stock options
Benefits: retirement, health/dental/vision insurance, flexible time off, remote work, training, parental leave, flex spending account

At Virtual Radiologic (vRad) you make a difference. Your skills, energy, and passion for results drive us to achieve strategic growth objectives and deliver quality patient care across the United States.
Virtual Radiologic is a national radiology practice and leader in the development of radiologist workflow technology. The dedication of vRad team members enables us to sustain our unique market-leading position and to provide the best quality and service to our customers and the patients we jointly serve. vRad team members exhibit energy and a passion for service excellence in our casually professional and collaborative work environment. We continually reward team members who embrace our fast-paced culture and who go the extra mile for our customers with internal recognition programs.
At vRad you make a difference.
WE ARE CURRENTLY LOOKING FOR A DATA SCIENTIST.
This position can be 100% remote or hybrid based out of our Eden Prairie, MN office.
About You:
You are a passionate, curious, and motivated professional that is trained and experienced in working with large amounts of complex data and translating it into useful information to drive improved business outcomes. You understand SQL and R programming languages at an intermediate or better level. You want to grow your skills at an organization where you feel like you can contribute and make an impact. You are a strong communicator and like working with other people as a team to accomplish your work, but also value some time working quietly or independently. You appreciate deadlines and try to meet them, and you’re always up for a challenge. You never settle for the bare minimum, and it shows because people know they can count on you for high quality and accurate work. You’re looking for your next challenge at a growing and exciting technology-focused and service-oriented organization where you can do your best work.
About Us:
vRad is the leading national teleradiology services and telemedicine company with over 500 U.S. board-certified and eligible physicians. Our team members are passionate about leading the industry and proving great service to our clients and the patients they serve. We leverage world class in-house developed tools to deliver radiology services to over 2,100 client hospitals, health systems, and radiology group facilities across the United States.
Summary:
The Data Scientist supports vRad’s Finance organization and other business functional areas by gathering, organizing, and analyzing data from multiple sources to extract trends and business insights. The incumbent will help leaders develop robust, sustainable, and well-organized processes to access and use data. The incumbent will also independently, and as part of various teams, work to develop predictive models, dashboards, and other business reports and present them to various levels within the organization. This position will require knowledge and use of database programming in either SQL or R to assist in gathering, analyzing, verifying, building and distributing data sets for use across the company. This role will also include a focus around automating existing and new reports and processes.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Gather and integrate data from disparate sources including MS SQL server, Salesforce, Excel workbooks, and other sources and present for enterprise-level consumption
Ensure data integrity and accuracy with a comprehensive understanding of the source(s) of truth
Create graphical, tabular, and written reports to communicate information to stakeholders across the organization at various levels
Assist with creation and deployment of long-term data management structure and data reporting tools
Help to automate current reporting tools and assist different departments with reporting needs in a sustainable fashion that adhere to department standards
Create statistical models using regression, multi-variate, or other modeling techniques to drive predictions
Thoroughly analyze data, quickly identify relevant information, and transform it into a meaningful output
Perform ad hoc analysis as needed
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications/Education:
Four-year degree or equivalent work experience and training
A natural curiosity and an aptitude to organize information in a way that makes it useful
3-5 years of SQL and R programming language knowledge and experience required
Strong systems aptitude, including Microsoft Excel
Able to work as part of a fast-paced team and bring his/her experience and positive attitude to supporting a high growth business model
Strong ability to prioritize multiple activities and remain flexible to change
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Organized, objective and deadline-oriented
Strong analytical skills and good business acumen

CACI is seeking a Mathematics / Statistical Scientist (Mid) to perform and manage the production of various products in coordination with project and program leadership. This position will support development and application of data mining analysis, aggregation, fusion, and visualization to process, analyze, and integrate raw data facilitating the production and dissemination of S&TI an GMI relating to foreign ground forces research, development, weapon systems, employment and operations. The candidate shall integrate statistical data analysis with geospatial data and services to produce web services in an interactive map application. The work involves ensuring data is available in actionable, standard, and usable forms and the application of intelligence principles in concert with a practical knowledge of information technology to provide technical mission support.
Primary Responsibilities:
Processing, tagging/labeling/parsing/indexing unstructured, semi-structured, and structured classified and unclassified data sets.
Developing research designs (including formulating testable questions, identifying and defining key concept and variables, and matching appropriate methods to problems.)
Data project management (including cleaning and preparing data) and creating, structuring, and maintaining data sets.
Data analysis and modeling (including manipulating datasets and interpreting findings using a mix of programs/environments (such as R, Python, Matlab, Excel) and techniques (e.g., text and pattern analysis, supervised and unsupervised data clustering, classification, change/anomaly detection, time-series, regression, geospatial, and/or social network analysis.)
Develop process flows/visualizations and technological developmental roadmaps and capturing them in the appropriate databases and data analysis tools.
Contribute to data-driven all-source analysis, assessment, and decision making and implement innovative methodologies which enhance production and dissemination activities.
Use text/web data analytics for establishing and expanding keyword searches and using bibliometric analysis tools to perform horizon scans and deep dives into identified S&T research fields
Provide knowledge/familiarity of technical language
Provide experience with Big Data (parallel processing power and options for handling analysis of data)
Understand the retrieval processes from databases using industry-standard query languages (e.g., SQL)

MA/MS degree in a related scientific field (Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics. etc.)
5+ years of experience as a Physical Scientist on DoD related programs and projects.

Education

1) Knowledge of SQL.
2) Knowledge of Python, R, or Java.

4) Knowledge of business intelligence solutions and dashboard development preferred.
5) Strong active listening skills.
6) Ability to take initiative and apply effective project management skills.
7) Ability to work independently.
8) Conducts business in a professional and cordial manner that upholds the integrity and reputation of Mount Nittany Health.

Job Name: Research Scientist / Statistician [Global Health & Higher Ed]
Job Description:
Experienced candidates (7+ years) only please.
Summary: The Research Scientist collaborates with our friendly team of social scientists to design and evaluate sponsored public health programs. Help make a difference in the world at our growing statistical research firm in downtown Austin.
Position Description
Far Harbor helps to design and evaluate research initiatives that aim to improve maternal, child and reproductive health in the US and developing countries. We seek an experienced applied research scientist or statistician with excellent communication skills to contribute on multidisciplinary teams and consult with our clients.
The Research Scientist works with diverse team members on long-term statistical consulting projects in public health. This person assists fellow scientific staff, conducts analyses of population health surveys, oversees data preparation and quality checking, develops analytic plans, reviews research products, and participates in authoring of peer-reviewed journal publications.
Experience/Skills Required
PhD in statistics, economics, psychology, sociology, or related social science strongly preferred
At least 3-5 years of professional experience as an applied research statistician (or in a position with significant statistical duties)
Graduate-level statistical training required (probability, sampling, general linear models)
Proficiency with SAS and other statistical software (data step processing, developing and calling SAS macros, and running statistical procedures); SAS programming expertise strongly preferred
Experience with multilevel analytic methods and/or weighted logistic regression
Familiarity with complex survey designs (clustered sampling, oversampling)
Experience with program evaluation and observational (or quasi-experimental) studies preferred
Good understanding of analytic methods for non-random samples, non-equivalent groups, selection bias, etc.
Some familiarity with psychometrics, measurement models, and/or structural equation modeling a plus
Friendly communication skills with the ability to present clear results to non-technical audiences
Excellent writing and demonstrated scientific publication experience
Applied consulting experience or project management a plus
Compensation
$88k-118k/year salary (based on experience) with annual bonus potential. Vacation, holidays, 401k plan, flex work benefits and company-paid access to the on-site gym.
About the Company
Far Harbor LLC (http://farharbor.com) is a statistical consultancy established in 2000 and based in Austin, TX. The firm offers expert research and analysis consulting to a number of federal, state, and international clients. We serve our clients primarily by assisting in the design and analysis of field research and population studies.
Work Location
This is a local position in our downtown Austin TX office; flex-hours and telework (Mon & Fri) are available with proficiency on projects. Our modern offices include a fitness center with showers for walking/running/biking to work. Occasional travel might be required (2-3 trips per year for client meetings). We follow CDC and city guidelines and implement policies for telework during pandemic spikes. We enjoy a collegial work environment and are motivated to provide excellent scientific work for our clients.
Application requirements
Please respond to this posting with the following items:
a well-written cover letter referencing this position and your primary qualifications and goals, -and-
a detailed CV or resume containing education, experience, and any specialized or technical skills relevant to the position.
Candidates who do not provide the above items or fail to meet the minimum skills/experience requirements will not be contacted. Qualified applicants will receive confirmation of receipt by email, and top candidates will be notified personally.
EEO Statement: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.
Please no recruiters or contract agencies. Thank you for your interest.

Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible.

Your Role and Responsibilities
As a Data Scientist working at the IBM Client Engineering, you will be the Subject Matter Expert on ML, Data and AI Statistical models and how they apply to business problems.
Led by a solution architect, you will advise on and help implement models in Machine Learning, Optimization, Neural Networks, and Artificial Intelligence such as Natural Language, and other quantitative approaches.
You will act as a key contributor partnering with clients to understand business problems and propose solutions.
You will deliver meaningful insights and predicts emerging trends to inform business solutions that optimize client value.
You will contribute to co-creation of rapid proofs of concept and minimally viable solutions that demonstrate business value, leading to client investment in strategic solutions.

To be successful in this role you:
are creative, out of the box thinker, you dare to try new ideas and innovation is always on your mind.
are familiar with Data Engineering techniques to gather, prepare, cleanse, and transform client data for analysis and AI automation, including automating data pipelines
Demonstrate strong business acumen and ability to understand business problems, formulate hypotheses and test conclusions to influence solution design
Leverage a variety of structured and unstructured data sources, analytics, AI tools, and programming languages to derive meaningful data insights (e.g., Python, R, Spark, TensorFlow, Jupyter, etc.)
Possess relevant industry and/or business domain knowledge such as Financial Services/Banking, Retail/Consumer Product, Telco, Public/HealthCare which you will apply to shape solutions
Expand partnerships at all levels of the client organization to identify new opportunities for data science applications
IBMReferred_NorthAmerica

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
At least 2 years as a Data Scientist with a deep understanding of Statistics, Machine Learning, NLP/NLU
At least 2 years of experience with identifying data sources, transforming data, and the use of Frameworks (e.g., MXNet, TensorFlow, PyTorch, SparkML, scikit-learn) to help our customers build ML models
At least 1 year in a client facing role, including facilitating client discussions and problem framing
Creative mind and out of the box thinking and you write code with Python, R, Scala, Java, C++ & G0

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Masters or PhD in a highly quantitative field (Data Science, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.)
Experience Consulting with client and taking on and solving complex business problems related to data, Ability to thrive in a startup environment and deliver on the end goals
Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment
Experience and Ability to work across multi clouds (IBM, AWS, GCP and Azure)

About Business Unit
IBM has a global presence, operating in more than 175 countries with a broad-based geographic distribution of revenue. The company’s Global Markets organization is a strategic sales business unit that manages IBM’s global footprint, working closely with dedicated country-based operating units to serve clients locally. These country teams have client relationship managers who lead integrated teams of consultants, solution specialists and delivery professionals to enable clients’ growth and innovation. By complementing local expertise with global experience and digital capabilities, IBM builds deep and broad-based client relationships. Job Description
Responsible for using experience and a hands-on approach to engage with Data Scientists and Data Engineers, resulting in the generation and consumption of data for various business initiatives on next-generation data platforms.
Responsibilities
Be the bridge between Data Scientist and Data Engineering to enable data application development. Understands at a fundamental level, our data ingestion and processing frameworks. Gathers data application requirements from Data Scientists and other operational teams to ensure that the business needs will be met. Designs transformation logic in source to targets to be implemented by partner Data Engineers. Partners with the Data Scientists and Data Engineers throughout the development and testing processes by ensuring that the team understands the parameters and needs of the project. Schedules and runs data application/model deployments and validations between Data Engineering and Data Scientists.
Utilizes deep knowledge of in-house data to assist Data Scientists in developing models, analytic processes, and reports to drive business value. Provides guidance to Data Scientists in creating efficient and fast-performing data consumption processes to meet service objectives. Highly efficient in understanding logic implemented in languages such as Python, R, and other analytics tools used by Data Scientists.
Provides support for deployed data applications and analytical models by being a trusted advisor to Data Scientists and other data consumers by identifying data problems and guiding issue-resolution with partner Data Engineers.
Ensures that proper data governance policies are followed by implementing or validating Data Lineage, Quality checks, classification, etc.
Minimum Qualifications
At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, or related field
2+ years of experience in data analysis, business analysis, data application programming, ETL development, or related field
In lieu of a degree, 4+ years of experience in data analysis, business analysis, data application programming, ETL development, or related field
Preferred Qualifications
If we had our say, we’d also look for:
Master’s degree in data analytics, or related field
Intermediate to deep knowledge of SQL
Experience working with various stakeholders
Exposure to business intelligence and reporting
Experience working on large scale / complex projects
Understanding of databases and data models

ADP is hiring a Principal Data Scientist. Does the thought of working with one of the most comprehensive employment data sets in the US excite you? Are you inspired by transformation and making an impact on the lives of millions of people every day? Well, this may be the role for you. Ready to design what's next?
In this role, you'll acquire, clean, and analyze large data sets and do exploratory analysis to understand our data and if it meets project requirements. It's more than digits and dials - you're making huge decisions that impact millions of customers.
Every day you'll work with multiple stakeholders to identify, design, develop and implement advanced analytics projects that track the consumer conversion funnel from start to end. You'll work with your team to provide, interpret, and predict necessary metrics for decision-making. You'll code with machine learning tools like Python, R, and Scala to synthesize millions of data sets into patterns that answer ad hoc requests and then use Tableau for data visualization.
To thrive in this career, you should know how to identify errors and reactively fix them. You will coach and mentor junior data scientists with different strengths to solve various problems with different methodologies and analyses. About SERVPRO
Servpro Industries, LLC, is a national leader of fire, water, mold, and other specialty cleanup and restoration services. With a professional services network of more than 2,000 franchises in the United States and Canada, SERVPRO quickly responds to property damage emergencies. These range from multimillion-dollar disasters to those suffered by individual businesses and homes. SERVPRO headquarters in Gallatin, Tennessee, is home to 400+ employees who are dedicated to supporting SERVPRO franchise operations. SERVPRO has been recognized by The Tennessean for its Top Workplace Award in 2015, 2016, 2017, 2019, 2020 and 2021

Job Summary
Servpro is excited to announce that it will be hiring a Data Scientist to join the Analytics team. This individual will focus on using diverse sets of structured and unstructured data to deliver business value across each of Servpro’s business functions. Additionally, this individual will own and drive key analytics solutions across every step of the project lifecycle: project scoping, execution, and operationalization.
Over the past year, we have focused on several priority analytics initiatives, such as market sizing, lead generation, job estimatics, and financial modeling. Our Data Scientists leverage modern statistical and geospatial processing tools in SQL, Python, and Tableau to build scalable infrastructure that drives key insights to stakeholders across our departments (Franchise Consulting, Marketing, Expansion, and National Accounts). Data Scientists have the unique benefit of playing a cross functional role in Servpro and contributing to priority transformation initiatives.
We are looking for individuals who are passionate about data science and are intellectually curious. We find our work exciting and hope that you do as well.

Major Duties and Responsibilities
Discover business narratives told by the data and present them to other scientists, business stakeholders, and managers at various levels
Develop and test heuristics
Create and run statistical and Machine Learning models
Perform data exploration and data mining
Create business intelligence, dashboards, visualizations, and/or other advanced analytics reports to adequately tell the business narrative and offer recommendations that are practiced, actionable, and have material impact, in addition to being well-supported by analytical models and data
Ensure that all technical application artifacts are archived in vaults such as Github or Bitbucket
Attend scheduled meetings for SERVPRO, Information Services, and the Analytics Team
Complete the assigned initiative tasks assigned for the quarter in a timely and accurate manner
Participate in planning and prioritization sessions as required
Provide other duties and functions as requested by management

Required Qualifications
At least 2 years of relevant Data Science or Data Engineering experience in a data-driven professional setting
Proficiency in multiple programming and querying languages, including Python and SQL
Experience with Data Visualization tools. Tableau experience preferred
Familiarity with big data analytical techniques and cloud technologies including Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Comfortable working with, and combining, disparate and diverse data sources, including json, xml, and geospatial
A strong intuition for analytical methodologies and desire to solve novel technical challenges
Excellence in balancing multiple projects and efficiently meet goals in a fast-paced environment
Strong written and verbal communication
Ability to work independently, as well as, on a team

Education
Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in statistics, physics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, or management of information systems. Graduate Degree preferred.

Working Conditions
Fast-paced, high pressure office environment.
Standard working hours based on a 40-hour work week.
Additional working hours required as needed to complete testing assignments and projects on schedule.
Minimal travel as required for business needs.

What we offer
Excellent health benefits plan, which includes medical, vision and dental options
401(k) with company match
Company profit sharing plan
Generous vacation, paid time-off and paid holidays
2 free on-site fitness rooms with class options
Weekly on-site massage therapist visits
Personal and professional development programs
Employee Assistance Program
Employee Resource Groups
“Financial Wellness” education and training programs

Job Name: Junior Cross Functional Data Visualization Developer
Job Description:
In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI). Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace.

Work you'll do

TOP SECRET CLEARANCE REQUIRED! The Junior Cross Functional Data Visualization Developer is responsible for working with customers and our clients to design, develop, implement, and support of enterprise application Business Intelligence (BI) reports. Working with a cross-functional teams, you will participate in gathering and documenting requirements to meet business needs. Using your skills and experience as a Junior Visualization Developer, you will use those requirements to help design, develop, test and implement reports and dashboards that utilize the underlying data to deliver Reporting products.

Candidate must have experience with a Data Visualization tool (e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, Qlik), SQL, testing, documenting requirements, familiarity with agile methodology, and conceptual understanding of Business Intelligence reporting applications. Experience with Oracle, Postgres, and/or MicroStrategy are preferred but not required.

The team

Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise.

The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients. Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights.

Qualifications

Required:
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future .
Active Top Secret clearance
1+ year of professional experience
Data analytics, user facing dashboard design
Data analysis and business recommendations
Analysis, reporting, visualization - reports, dashboarding
Working with key stakeholders/clients - user/system requirements to specifications
Technical experience with Excel and PowerPoint
ETL concepts and data warehouse/relational database concepts (I.e., understanding/exposure)
Work with customer/business owners for gathering/developing requirements
Functional data, performance, system, security requirements (I.e., types of business requirements)


Preferred:


Experience with Oracle, Postgres, and/or MicroStrategy


How you'll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

WE ARE CURRENTLY LOOKING FOR A DATA SCIENTIST.

About You:

You understand SQL and R programming languages at an intermediate or better level. You want to grow your skills at an organization where you feel like you can contribute and make an impact. vRad is the leading national teleradiology services and telemedicine company with over 500 U.S. board-certified and eligible physicians. Our team members are passionate about leading the industry and proving great service to our clients and the patients they serve. We leverage world class in-house developed tools to deliver radiology services to over 2,100 client hospitals, health systems, and radiology group facilities across the United States.
Summary:
The Data Scientist supports vRad’s Finance organization and other business functional areas by gathering, organizing, and analyzing data from multiple sources to extract trends and business insights. The incumbent will help leaders develop robust, sustainable, and well-organized processes to access and use data. The incumbent will also independently, and as part of various teams, work to develop predictive models, dashboards, and other business reports and present them to various levels within the organization. This position will require knowledge and use of database programming in either SQL or R to assist in gathering, analyzing, verifying, building and distributing data sets for use across the company. This role will also include a focus around automating existing and new reports and processes.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Gather and integrate data from disparate sources including MS SQL server, Salesforce, Excel workbooks, and other sources and present for enterprise-level consumption
Ensure data integrity and accuracy with a comprehensive understanding of the source(s) of truth
Create graphical, tabular, and written reports to communicate information to stakeholders across the organization at various levels
Assist with creation and deployment of long-term data management structure and data reporting tools
Help to automate current reporting tools and assist different departments with reporting needs in a sustainable fashion that adhere to department standards
Create statistical models using regression, multi-variate, or other modeling techniques to drive predictions
Thoroughly analyze data, quickly identify relevant information, and transform it into a meaningful output
Perform ad hoc analysis as needed
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications/Education:
Four-year degree or equivalent work experience and training
A natural curiosity and an aptitude to organize information in a way that makes it useful
3-5 years of SQL and R programming language knowledge and experience required
Strong systems aptitude, including Microsoft Excel
Able to work as part of a fast-paced team and bring his/her experience and positive attitude to supporting a high growth business model
Strong ability to prioritize multiple activities and remain flexible to change
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Organized, objective and deadline-oriented
Strong analytical skills and good business acumen

About the Position:
Crescent Bank is looking for a Data Scientist who will build models and analyses that lead to a better understanding of how our business performs.

The person in this role will be expected to identify and implement potential solutions that will drive overall performance and profitability of the company. This will include creating analytical frameworks to evaluate solutions to various risks and opportunities related to the business. The person in this role will also be expected to monitor performance of specific business areas and related testing and draw insights for improvement opportunities. In addition, the person in the role will be expected to use analytical techniques to ground the value of different solutions.

CACI is seeking a Mathematics / Statistical Scientist (Mid) to perform and manage the production of various products in coordination with project and program leadership. This position will support development and application of data mining analysis, aggregation, fusion, and visualization to process, analyze, and integrate raw data facilitating the production and dissemination of S&TI an GMI relating to foreign ground forces research, development, weapon systems, employment and operations. The candidate shall integrate statistical data analysis with geospatial data and services to produce web services in an interactive map application. The work involves ensuring data is available in actionable, standard, and usable forms and the application of intelligence principles in concert with a practical knowledge of information technology to provide technical mission support.
Primary Responsibilities:
Processing, tagging/labeling/parsing/indexing unstructured, semi-structured, and structured classified and unclassified data sets.
Developing research designs (including formulating testable questions, identifying and defining key concept and variables, and matching appropriate methods to problems.)
Data project management (including cleaning and preparing data) and creating, structuring, and maintaining data sets.
Data analysis and modeling (including manipulating datasets and interpreting findings using a mix of programs/environments (such as R, Python, Matlab, Excel) and techniques (e.g., text and pattern analysis, supervised and unsupervised data clustering, classification, change/anomaly detection, time-series, regression, geospatial, and/or social network analysis.)
Develop process flows/visualizations and technological developmental roadmaps and capturing them in the appropriate databases and data analysis tools.
Contribute to data-driven all-source analysis, assessment, and decision making and implement innovative methodologies which enhance production and dissemination activities.
Use text/web data analytics for establishing and expanding keyword searches and using bibliometric analysis tools to perform horizon scans and deep dives into identified S&T research fields
Provide knowledge/familiarity of technical language
Provide experience with Big Data (parallel processing power and options for handling analysis of data)
Understand the retrieval processes from databases using industry-standard query languages (e.g., SQL)
Minimum Education and Experience Required:
MA/MS degree in a related scientific field (Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics. etc.)
5+ years of experience as a Physical Scientist on DoD related programs and projects.
Basic Qualifications:
Active in scope DoD TS/SCI security clearance. Must be willing to obtain a CI Polygraph
Ability to conduct analysis and produce comprehensive technical assessments that include independent research and technical writing.
Must possess the ability to work independently with minimal oversight while maintaining focus on research objectives defined by the client.

What We Can Offer You:

We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.

Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.

We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.

We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities.

For over 55 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.

Job Name: Sr Data Scientist / Business Intelligence Analyst
Job Description:
Company Overview:
At Memorial Sloan Kettering (MSK), we’re not only changing the way we treat cancer, but also the way the world thinks about it. By working together and pushing forward with innovation and discovery, we’re driving excellence and improving outcomes. We’re treating cancer, one patient at a time. Join us and make a difference every day.

In compliance with applicable New York and New Jersey State regulatory authorities, COVID-19 vaccination (2 doses of either the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine or one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine) is mandatory for all MSK employees, contingent workers, and volunteers. Exceptions are permitted for those who request and receive an approved medical or fully remote exemption. A COVID-19 booster, after 2 doses of either the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine or one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine, isn’t required at this time but is highly effective and strongly encouraged for all staff.
Job Description:
We are seeking a Data Scientist / Business Intelligence Analyst who has both strong technical skills and a passion for applying them to real-world problems, to partner with the General Manager of MSK Direct, as well as other MSK Direct leadership to analyze and optimize the MSK Direct program. MSK Direct is the largest and highest-quality cancer benefits solution in the U.S., partnering with employers and unions as well as health plans and digital health companies.

This position is part of the Embedded Analytics Program, which allows our analysts to be a full member of an operational team to truly understand and meet their needs, while still being part of a community of fellow analytical experts.
You will focus on projects to support the growth of MSK Direct, including:
Creating and maintaining external and internal reporting and conducting analyses to demonstrate the value of the program to our employer and union partners, and optimize the services we deliver
Establish and run a platform and experiments within that platform to ensure that decisions about the future of the program (product, marketing, partnerships) are made based on data
You are:
A storyteller, able to synthesize knowledge from a variety of sources and clearly communicate complex topics to non-technical audiences
You have:
4+ years of experience of using analytics and data science to impact key business decisions and related experience in statistics, economics, operations research or mathematics.
An ability to choose the right technical approach and know that the simplest solution is often the best. Manage analytical projects from "question to answer" including problem framing, data collection and validation, exploratory analysis, statistical modeling, visualization, synthesis, and ongoing maintenance of reusable tools
Conducted reproducible analyses using R (preferably) or Python and as comfortable with statistical methods. You’re deeply comfortable with relational databases and SQL, Tableau or a similar BI tool
We offer an outstanding compensation package, healthcare benefits, and retirement saving plan. Apply today and find out more! We believe in communication, openness, and thinking beyond your 8-hour day @ MSK. It’s important to us that you have a sense of impact, community, and work/life balance to be and feel your best.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Data Scientist role will develop and own analysis and reporting on acquisition, retention, and revenue activities for Benefytt's carrier relations. This position will partner with the larger Analytics, Data Engineering, Marketing, and Finance teams to interpret third-party revenue data and generate business understanding and insights. As part of an expanding analytics team, the function will take advantage of tremendous opportunities to develop analyses and processes to fuel Benefytt’s growth.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Using data analysis skills (SQL and R/Python), expand on business understanding by measuring acquisition, retention and LTV measurement methodologies and models
Develop end-to-end customer lifecycle model (from lead to client to revenue)
Partnering with the Data Engineering and Product Development teams, continue development of Benefytt’s datasets to drive increased business understanding and insights faster
Create and deliver reporting and presentation packages to various stakeholders and partners across the enterprise
Assist in relationship management with external partners with the goal of increased data accessibility and accuracy
Partner with Marketing team to help develop and measure experiments to increase client retention
Help Benefytt become a more data-driven company through partnering and coaching other employees in analytic topics/questions
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS (EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, SKILLS):
Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Finance or similar field of study strongly preferred
3+ years of hands-on experience in working with large datasets, with a focus on turning business questions into insights
Proficiency in various database environment, such as SQL Server, Oracle or AWS and proven experience to extract data with intermediate to advanced SQL skills (a short take-home coding exercise will be required)
Hands-on experience with Python or R to perform analyses (a short take-home coding exercise will be required)
Experience with data visualization tools like PowerBI, Looker, Tableau, etc. preferred
Experience with hypothesis testing desirable
Strong written, listening, spoken and presentation communication skills to deliver results and influence decision makers

Overview:
As a Lead Data Scientist, you will be responsible for leading significant role-specific forecasting project work as part of a larger, cross-functional team in support of one or more lines of business. Lead Data Scientists typically leverage and implement pre-defined analytics patterns and infrastructure on projects that are moderately complex, requiring working knowledge of a more limited set of machine learning or advanced modeling forecasting approaches. They must be able to quickly learn new subject-matter in support of a specific project or task. Our Lead Data Scientists typically work with latitude for action or decisions on specific projects, solutions, or technical issues. They may represent Enterprise Analytics, the team's sub-department, in internal conversations. Successful candidates for this role must have strong analytical and research skills, a strong understanding of statistics and statistical modeling, a basic understanding of modern machine learning and its mathematical underpinnings, and they must have moderate programming skills with SQL, R and/or Python. They will need to be fast learners with a keen eye for detail, systems thinking, and process design. They must be team players who work steadfastly to create impactful change. This is a professional track role.
Responsibilities:
Constructs and maintains automated workflows creating hierarchical, distributional forecasts of interrelated topics with several granularities (time and grouping aggregation)
Analyzes time series data and applies models, algorithms, and/or simulations to solve simple to moderately complex business or technical problems by leveraging existing patterns or algorithms (ARIMA, Exponential Smoothing, LSTM, Prophet, LightGBM, etc.) as a part of a larger team
Leverages pre-defined cloud compute resources and technology
Performs statistical analysis to establish causal relationships between drivers and outcomes
Acts as an individual contributor on project engagements and is responsible for implementing data science best practice in their work
Develops and manages ETL pipes in support of their specific analytic project work
Owns and is accountable for model and code quality and documentation for the project work they execute
Supports Analytic Translators in their work to communicate and present findings and to deliver training to business partners and key stakeholders, as needed
Performs ad-hoc analysis as necessary to support project work
Helps drive projects to success, enables others to own the project’s impact on the business
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in a Quantitative or Technical Degree Program and 3.2 GPA
0-3 years experience
Has familiarity with traditional forecasting methods (ARIMA, Exponential Smoothing)
Has strong analytical and research skills
Has a strong understanding of statistics and statistical modeling.
Has basic understanding of modern machine learning and its mathematical underpinnings.
Has moderate programming skills in SQL, R and/or Python.
Has the skill to partner with cross-functional teams using strong written and verbal communication.
Is a fast learner and a proven problem solver.
Has a keen eye for system thinking and process design, especially with respect to scalability and automation.
Has a keen eye for detail and thoughtful investigation of data.
Has a steadfast focus on creating impactful change.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master's Degree in a Quantitative or Technical Degree Program and 3.2 GPA
3+ years experience
Has experience implementing forecasting methods
Has some experience using the AWS big data technology stack
Has any experience developing machine learning or advanced statistical modesl any context

Headquartered in San Diego, Mulligan Funding serves as a leading provider of working capital ($5K - $2M) to the small and medium-sized businesses that fuel our country. Since 2008, we have prided ourselves on our collaborative, innovative, and customer-focused approach. Enjoying a period of unprecedented growth, driven by the combination of cutting-edge technology, human touch, and unwavering integrity, we are looking to add to our people-first culture, with highly motivated and results-oriented professionals, to push the limits of what's possible while creating value for all of our partners.

We are seeking a junior statistician, quantitative modeling specialist, or data scientist to join our data science team’s Risk division. If you have exceptional analytical, quantitative and problem-solving skills, some experience in building models in the financial context, a proven track record of bringing your own insights and ideas to problems, the ability to work independently and collaboratively, and the desire to make a direct impact on the success of the business, this is an opportunity for you.

The ideal candidate has an advanced degree in statistics, economics, mathematics or a related field; 1-2 years experience in data analytics and statistical modeling; strong inner motivation to learn, grow and contribute significantly on the job; intellectual curiosity and honesty; exceptional attention to detail; and excellent interpersonal skills.

This is a hybrid role out of our San Diego, CA office, with the standard working hours of 8 AM to 5 PM.
You will:
Research, implement and test innovative statistical models for underwriting and other areas of the business.
Work independently, under guidance from and in collaboration with the data science team, particularly the head of Risk Data Science.
Identify relevant data sources and data sets to deliver insights and analysis for business decision-making.
Source, cleanse and verify data.
Work closely with Analytics and Technology teams to deploy models in production.
Communicate statistical solutions to parties across the business in the form of presentations and other materials.
Own the accuracy and precision of analysis.
You have:
B.A. or above in statistics, economics, finance, applied mathematics, or related discipline (Master’s preferred)
1-2 years experience in model implementation in fintech, banking or related field
1-2 years experience in data analysis to support business decisions
Basic knowledge or strong interest in credit products and risk analysis
Independence in problem solving, and ability to own a problem from start to finish
Fluency with statistical modeling and familiarity with machine learning methods
Fluency with SQL and Python
Proficiency with descriptive data analysis and presentation
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Ability and desire to work collaboratively
Intellectual curiosity and creativity
Strong written and verbal communication skills
We Offer:
Great Medical, Vision and Dental Benefits.
Health Savings Account.
Flexible Spending Accounts.
Life and disability insurance.
Fantastic 401K with matching contribution.
Sick, Vacation, and Holidays.
Gym membership contribution.
Employee Assistance Program (EAP) – mental health support.
Online commuter benefits.
Internal Referral Program.
Fun team and company events.
Start-up culture, within an established business with 13 years of experience.
Great central location in San Diego – easy access from highway.

Job Description:
We are GDIT. As one of the largest IT and mission services providers to the government, we own our opportunities to better enable healthcare organizations to identify theirs.
You can make GDIT your place. You make it your own by turning obstacles into action. Collaborates with Subject Matter Experts and other Data Scientists to create unique AI and ML solutions

Job Name: Research Scientist / Statistician [Global Health & Higher Ed]
Job Description:
Experienced candidates (7+ years) only please.
Summary: The Research Scientist collaborates with our friendly team of social scientists to design and evaluate sponsored public health programs. Help make a difference in the world at our growing statistical research firm in downtown Austin.
Position Description
Far Harbor helps to design and evaluate research initiatives that aim to improve maternal, child and reproductive health in the US and developing countries. We seek an experienced applied research scientist or statistician with excellent communication skills to contribute on multidisciplinary teams and consult with our clients.
The Research Scientist works with diverse team members on long-term statistical consulting projects in public health. This person assists fellow scientific staff, conducts analyses of population health surveys, oversees data preparation and quality checking, develops analytic plans, reviews research products, and participates in authoring of peer-reviewed journal publications.
Experience/Skills Required
PhD in statistics, economics, psychology, sociology, or related social science strongly preferred
At least 3-5 years of professional experience as an applied research statistician (or in a position with significant statistical duties)
Graduate-level statistical training required (probability, sampling, general linear models)
Proficiency with SAS and other statistical software (data step processing, developing and calling SAS macros, and running statistical procedures); SAS programming expertise strongly preferred
Experience with multilevel analytic methods and/or weighted logistic regression
Familiarity with complex survey designs (clustered sampling, oversampling)
Experience with program evaluation and observational (or quasi-experimental) studies preferred
Good understanding of analytic methods for non-random samples, non-equivalent groups, selection bias, etc.
Some familiarity with psychometrics, measurement models, and/or structural equation modeling a plus
Friendly communication skills with the ability to present clear results to non-technical audiences
Excellent writing and demonstrated scientific publication experience
Applied consulting experience or project management a plus
Compensation
$88k-118k/year salary (based on experience) with annual bonus potential. Vacation, holidays, 401k plan, flex work benefits and company-paid access to the on-site gym.
About the Company
Far Harbor LLC (http://farharbor.com) is a statistical consultancy established in 2000 and based in Austin, TX. The firm offers expert research and analysis consulting to a number of federal, state, and international clients. We serve our clients primarily by assisting in the design and analysis of field research and population studies.
Work Location
This is a local position in our downtown Austin TX office; flex-hours and telework (Mon & Fri) are available with proficiency on projects. Our modern offices include a fitness center with showers for walking/running/biking to work. Occasional travel might be required (2-3 trips per year for client meetings). We follow CDC and city guidelines and implement policies for telework during pandemic spikes. We enjoy a collegial work environment and are motivated to provide excellent scientific work for our clients.
Application requirements
Please respond to this posting with the following items:
a well-written cover letter referencing this position and your primary qualifications and goals, -and-
a detailed CV or resume containing education, experience, and any specialized or technical skills relevant to the position.
Candidates who do not provide the above items or fail to meet the minimum skills/experience requirements will not be contacted. Qualified applicants will receive confirmation of receipt by email, and top candidates will be notified personally.
EEO Statement: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.
Please no recruiters or contract agencies. Thank you for your interest.

Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible.

Your Role and Responsibilities
As a Data Scientist working at the IBM Client Engineering, you will be the Subject Matter Expert on ML, Data and AI Statistical models and how they apply to business problems.
Led by a solution architect, you will advise on and help implement models in Machine Learning, Optimization, Neural Networks, and Artificial Intelligence such as Natural Language, and other quantitative approaches.
You will act as a key contributor partnering with clients to understand business problems and propose solutions.
You will deliver meaningful insights and predicts emerging trends to inform business solutions that optimize client value.
You will contribute to co-creation of rapid proofs of concept and minimally viable solutions that demonstrate business value, leading to client investment in strategic solutions.

To be successful in this role you:
are creative, out of the box thinker, you dare to try new ideas and innovation is always on your mind.
are familiar with Data Engineering techniques to gather, prepare, cleanse, and transform client data for analysis and AI automation, including automating data pipelines
Demonstrate strong business acumen and ability to understand business problems, formulate hypotheses and test conclusions to influence solution design
Leverage a variety of structured and unstructured data sources, analytics, AI tools, and programming languages to derive meaningful data insights (e.g., Python, R, Spark, TensorFlow, Jupyter, etc.)
Possess relevant industry and/or business domain knowledge such as Financial Services/Banking, Retail/Consumer Product, Telco, Public/HealthCare which you will apply to shape solutions
Expand partnerships at all levels of the client organization to identify new opportunities for data science applications
IBMReferred_NorthAmerica

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
At least 2 years as a Data Scientist with a deep understanding of Statistics, Machine Learning, NLP/NLU
At least 2 years of experience with identifying data sources, transforming data, and the use of Frameworks (e.g., MXNet, TensorFlow, PyTorch, SparkML, scikit-learn) to help our customers build ML models
At least 1 year in a client facing role, including facilitating client discussions and problem framing
Creative mind and out of the box thinking and you write code with Python, R, Scala, Java, C++ & G0

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Masters or PhD in a highly quantitative field (Data Science, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.)
Experience Consulting with client and taking on and solving complex business problems related to data, Ability to thrive in a startup environment and deliver on the end goals
Demonstrable track record of dealing well with ambiguity, prioritizing needs, and delivering results in a dynamic environment
Experience and Ability to work across multi clouds (IBM, AWS, GCP and Azure)

About Business Unit
IBM has a global presence, operating in more than 175 countries with a broad-based geographic distribution of revenue. The company’s Global Markets organization is a strategic sales business unit that manages IBM’s global footprint, working closely with dedicated country-based operating units to serve clients locally. These country teams have client relationship managers who lead integrated teams of consultants, solution specialists and delivery professionals to enable clients’ growth and innovation. By complementing local expertise with global experience and digital capabilities, IBM builds deep and broad-based client relationships. This local management focus fosters speed in supporting clients, addressing new markets and making investments in emerging opportunities. Additionally, the Global Markets organization serves clients with expertise in their industry as well as through the products and services that IBM and partners supply. IBM is also expanding its reach to new and existing clients through digital marketplaces.

Your Life @ IBM
Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

It's time to define your career.

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

We are looking for an ESG & Sustainability Data Analyst to help the Sustainability Function manage its sustainability-related data, analyze findings and conduct research on Environmental, Social Governance (ESG) related matters. This position analyzes structured and unstructured sustainability and business data to provide insights into the sustainability impacts of Colgate’s operations throughout its value-chain. This role will require data mining and advanced analytics skills to conduct relational-analysis, categorizations. Statistical analysis and forecasting.
This person will also work with various functions to help build and collect sustainability data and ensure data accuracy. They will conduct research on impact valuation models and provide recommendations to better link sustainability actions to financial returns. An understanding of the Sustainability and ESG data, as well as reporting tools on these areas are preferred. This role might also require support for the ESG reporting processes.
Responsibilities
Create and maintain robust ESG data.
Visualize sustainability and ESG data through sophisticated analytics.
Build now-cast or forecast models to predict company ESG characteristics (GHG emissions, water use, material use, impact on deforestation, for suppliers who do not disclose those metrics) by using ML and other forecasting techniques.
Apply data mining and ML libraries to analyze noisy sustainability-related data and drive conclusions.
Analyze financial and ESG data, conduct scenario analysis to understand financial impacts of ESG issues.
Provide solutions to the unstructured data ESG environment and data gaps
Analyze survey data from internal and external partners.
Analyze open source and social media data to identity trends in ESG and sustainability.
Connect with internal partners and handle projects to collect and manage data.
Provide support for ESG reporting as needed.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree.
Strong passion for Data, Sustainability, ESG technology and finance.
At least 2 years of relevant working experience in an analytical role involving data extraction, analysis, statistical modeling, and visualization.
Interest in maturing technologies such as Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence or Natural Language Processing.
Proven project or work experience using one more languages such as R, Python or SQL.
Experience manipulating large data sets through object oriented programming (Python, R or other statistical programming).
Experience managing structured and unstructured data using tools such as SQL, Python, Tableau and other systems.
Ability to assess and benchmark online data solutions and suggest innovative solutions to complex problems.
Experience with survey analytics, data management and understanding data structure.
Ability to engage with collaborators, communicate results and suggest solutions through translating technical knowledge into business needs.
Preferred Qualifications
Research mentality with a focus on sustainability, scenario analysis and impact valuation modeling
Knowledge of the ESG reporting frameworks, such as SASB, GRI, Bloomberg ESG, CDP, TCFD and others
Experience in data analytics and BI tools included but not limited to Tableau, Google Data Studio, R and/or others.

Are you a Data Scientist who is passionate about creating value out of data? Emerson has a great opportunity for you! Based in our St. Louis headquarters, you will support our product, sales, operations / supply-chain and leadership teams with insights gained from analyzing various sources of data and analyze it for a better understanding about how the business performs. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams.
As a Data Scientist, You Will:
The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes by providing actionable insights.
Create customer-focused analytics with peer groups across the business
Discover opportunities to improve systems, processes and enterprises through data analytics and automation
Build and implement models, using/creating algorithms and simulations for decision-making via the use of data visualization tools
Develop key understanding of the Commercial and Residential Solutions portfolio of businesses and how different data sets can be employed to enhance performance in stakeholder satisfaction.
Employ data storytelling to communicate actionable insights to a broad audience through a combination of; business intuition, analytical thinking, critical thinking, curiosity/inquisitiveness and interpersonal skills.
Who you are:
Flexible Work Schedule – Remote Work Option and Core Hours
This role has the flexibility of a remote work option up to three days a week and a core hour schedule. You can choose to flex your start and stop times given you are working during the core hours of 9:00am - 3:00pm. Our teams work together to ensure our chosen work schedules enable our creativity and productivity as we serve the needs of our customers. Ability to travel up to 15% for the role
Required Education, Experience & Skills:
Bachelor’s in Applied Statistics, Analytics, Data Science or other relevant field or 5 years of relevant experience in a technology field
Applicant must have experience coding Python, MATLAB, R, or similar language
Must be able to process, clean, and verify the integrity of raw data.
Must have strong applied statistic skills such as understanding of probability distributions, statistical inference, and experimental design
Must be able to work through the development of algorithms for complex systems for the purposes of understanding, prediction and optimization
Must have strong problem solving and written / verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams .
Preferred Education, Experience & Skill:
MBA preferred with 5 years of relevant experience (with a BS in analytical discipline, business, supply-chain or equivalent)
Experience with modeling techniques for complex systems and machine learning
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure Cloud, Snowflake, and/or AWS
Familiarity with database query language such as SQL
Benefits
Emerson places a high value on ensuring that team members have a good work-life balance. We provide access to a competitive benefits package, including the following: medical insurance, dental and vision coverage, 401k participation with a competitive immediate match, fitness center, tuition reimbursement, parental leave, and an online wellness rewards program. Immediate vacation and holiday leave available. Team member resource groups ensure that the Emerson values are incorporated into everyday team member life.
Why Work in St. Louis, Missouri
Our facility is in St. Louis, famous for its Gateway Arch standing at 630 feet tall. St Louis is a family-friendly, historic metropolitan area with a low cost of living and first-class schools. The city offers excellent restaurants, shopping areas, art galleries, and numerous festivals throughout the year, making this an exciting place to live and work.
About our Location
This location is the host of Emerson’s corporate headquarters and Commercial and Residential Solutions Tools, Hermetic Motors, and other businesses. Our products, such as the InSinkErator, Sensi, and RIDGID have become household names that support the comfort and well-being of our customers. The ComRes platform employees at this location provide support to the various businesses within Commercial and Residential Solutions, allowing for many networking opportunities across businesses. The connectedness between ComRes and Corporate employees allows for a close relationship and the opportunity to explore opportunities across Emerson.

Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world’s leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our employees do the can’t be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers.
Peraton currently seeks an experienced Data Scientist to provide support to a Department of Defense research laboratory.

This is a remote/telework opportunity, with a strong preference for someone with the ability to work on site in Monterey, CA.

Roles and responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:
Develop data mining and modeling plans; describe, explore, and verify data quality; select, clean, construct, integrate, and format data; select modeling techniques; generate training, testing, and validation designs; build and evaluate models; develop visualizations of model results.
Responsible for developing statistical models and methods to support predictive analytics to help Army Leaders achieve and sustain individual readiness and optimize human performance.
This position requires data analytics, statistics, mathematical and communication skills while working in a multi-functional team environment.
Applies operations research, statistical, mathematical, and analytical techniques related to Health, Resilience, and Personal Readiness.
Provides analysis and develops information papers, presentations, and other correspondence as required.
Presents data to senior military and civilian leaders and provides recommendations as necessary.
Performs data consolidation, cleansing and analysis, and presents data from one or more source systems.

Basic Qualifications:
BS/BA degree and minimum 5-7 years relevant experience or MS degree and minimum of 3-5 years relevant experience or PhD and minimum 0-2 years relevant work experience
Experience with machine learning models, such as logistic regression, support vector machines, principal component analysis, clustering techniques (e.g., k-means, hierarchical), tree-based techniques, neural networks, and deep learning models.
Knowledge of and proficiency in R and/or Python.
Proficiency with data analysis and basic analytics.
Demonstrated experience in Oracle or SQL.
Ability to comprehend and analyze complex problems.
An understanding in performing basic data exploratory analysis and strong data visualization skills.
U.S. Citizenship and the ability to obtain/maintain Department of Defense (DoD) Secret security clearance.
Preferred Qualifications
Demonstrated strength and mastery in SQL and either R or Python.
Demonstrated experience developing data visualization products such as R Shiny and Tableau.
Military experience or other experience supporting the DoD.
Background in biostatistics, epidemiology, or behavioral research.
Active DoD Secret Clearance

Overview
Located in Boston and the surrounding communities, Dana-Farber Cancer Institute is a leader in life changing breakthroughs in cancer research and patient care. We are united in our mission of conquering cancer, HIV/AIDS and related diseases. We strive to create an inclusive, diverse, and equitable environment where we provide compassionate and comprehensive care to patients of all backgrounds, and design programs to promote public health particularly among high-risk and underserved populations. We conduct groundbreaking research that advances treatment, we educate tomorrow's physician/researchers, and we work with amazing partners, including other Harvard Medical School-affiliated hospitals.
The Senior Clinical Data Analyst will be responsible for defining cancer research data needs, identifying/profiling data in clinical systems, specifying analytic repository requirements, defining data quality processes and developing metadata. In this role, the incumbent will work collaboratively with the DFCI clinical research community and Informatics staff to enhance access to clinical and genomics data needed to support the cancer research.
The incumbent will report to the Director of Research Data Services and will be expected to manage their work with minimal guidance including requirements gathering with researchers, working with the enterprise data warehouse team on analytic repository design and implementation, and ensuring the quality of data delivered to the research community.
Responsibilities
Work with researcher to define the data they need from DFCI, affiliate and external systems to support cancer research.
Determine where required data is stored in clinical systems and profile data to assess quality.
Develop specifications for the creation of analytic repositories in the DFCI Enterprise Data Warehouse for storing clinical and genomic data. Specifications will include direction on data integration, terminology use, standardization, and derived element development.
Work with the enterprise data warehouse team to ensure that quality of the data that is moved into analytic repositories.
Collaborate with researchers and other informatics staff to develop data dictionaries, data models and other metadata that will enhance the usability of the data.
Provide data training and support to researchers and informatics staff.
Participate in the development of data governance policies and processes to ensure that data use complies with information security and privacy standards.
Work collaboratively with other informatics staff to develop processes ensure the quality and completeness of research data being generated from all source systems.
Responsible for the security and confidentiality of private medical and financial information.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Science, Mathematics, Business, Information Systems, Public Health, or related field required; graduate degree preferred.
5+ years of experience performing data analysis in a professional setting, healthcare or research experience strongly preferred.
Demonstrated experience working with customers, developing requirements, doing data analysis with SQL and designing relational databases required.
At Dana-Farber Cancer Institute, we work every day to create an innovative, caring, and inclusive environment where every patient, family, and staff member feels they belong. As relentless as we are in our mission to reduce the burden of cancer for all, we are equally committed to diversifying our faculty and staff. Cancer knows no boundaries and when it comes to hiring the most dedicated and diverse professionals, neither do we. If working in this kind of organization inspires you, we encourage you to apply.

Key Role:
Collaborate and support the growth of an analytics team with responsibility to perform advanced analyses and studies of Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS). Assist CMS with health care and payment policy rulemaking activities. Monitor and assess the impact of policy and payment changes on access to care, beneficiary health outcomes, and Medicare payments. Conduct active surveillance of notable trends in Medicare payment systems. Assist CMS in its efforts to identify and assess exposure to fraud, waste, and abuse in the Medicare program. Evaluate the impact of initiatives aimed at preventing or recovering improper payments. Conduct numerous and varied ad hoc data analyses. This position is open to remote delivery anywhere within the U.S., to include the District of Columbia.
Basic Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in a managerial role overseeing projects, budgets, and staff
Experience with working with Government Payer programs
Experience with building analytic solutions and products and developing payer data analysts
Knowledge of CMS claims data, including Medicare and Medicaid, in either the Integrated Data Repository (IDR) or Chronic Conditions Warehouse (CCW) environment with Fee-for-Service (FFS), Medicare Advantage encounter data, or Prescription Drug Event (PDE) data
Knowledge of analytic scripting, programming languages and packages, including SAS Viya, R, Python, Tableau, QuickSight, or Qlik
Knowledge of both federal and state payer data, including encounter data, fraud, and program integrity tactics
Ability to apply Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) and automation techniques to drive insights and efficiency
Ability to obtain a security clearance
Bachelor's degree
Additional Qualifications:
Experience with delivering technical assistance to a wide range of stakeholders and using a variety of delivery techniques
Experience with facilitating large meetings with both internal and external audiences
Experience with the federal procurement and proposal process
Knowledge of or experience with Amazon WebServices (AWS) or specifically the CMS AWS Enclave
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
Compensation:
The proposed salary range for this position in Colorado is 135,000 to 150,000. Final salary will be determined based on various factors.
